hmm, to be honest, I haven't had much experience with TDD or JUnit 
till I =
started on my honors project  about a couple of months ago. 
I've done much=
 research however and have written a small lab 
excercise using TDD.

As fo=
r what makes me think its a good idea, well basically all the 
articles I r=
ead and the people I've spoken to remark on two reasons 
why people do not =
pick up TDD, firstly being the test-first concept 
of it is difficult to gr=
asp and secondly that they do not see the 
benefits in using it.

Well Juni=
t was designed to allow repeated testing and I figure if it 
could be furth=
er extended to generate the basic test cases it could 
save alot of time an=
d effort on the tester's part.

I mean from personal experience I thought i=
t was hell of a tedious 
to generate all the assert statements usually need=
ed to test a given 
unit of code i.e. a method. So I thought why not auto g=
enerate some 
test cases? I dont mean all of them since testing is creative=
 
work...but surely the basic few?

Stressed,
Jimm

oups.com, Ilja Preuss <it@...> wrote:

 - what tells
